ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It was a wonderful course everyone should take, regardless of whether you are a genetics PhD or not. You will learn a lot about analysis and scientific thinking and the discussions will provide a foundation for learning about other people's lab experiences, such as those working on model organisms versus those working on humans.
I would strongly recommend this class to anyone in the biological sciences as inevitably anybody in the BBS will have to put at least some of the skills learned in this class to use.
I would recommend this class, it was a good overview of genetic techniques.
Probably not...I didnt really learn much in the class
A lot of basics, but worth knowing and relearning.
I will recommend to take another basic genetics course before taking this class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I now think differently and don't take regular scientific practice as the status quo. I question things and methodologies and scientific thinking.
It helps me a lot in deeply understanding genetics
It increased my knowledge of genetics a lot (I didn't have very much before).
I learned many new techniques I could use in terms of genetics.
